author: James C. Whitten

review: I am very pleased with this purchase. I have to admit that I was looking at other streaming sticks and I couldn't figure out which one that I would like that best...and I am glad that I got this one. It was very easy to set up. I am no where near tech savvy and I had no problem setting this Roku up. I have no problems with my remote paring with my stick (as I have read that some have had that problem). The remote was fairly easy to understand and use. I still an in the process of trying to figure and explore what all it can do...but so far I am very happy with it. :)
author: Charity Hope

review: I just got it today .  So far set up was fast .  At first we cannot find the Roku on HDM1 and it took a few minutes before the Roku sign came up on the tv but once it did registering went well, entered my wifi account and password and was done. Only issue I have is I cannot get back to ATT Uverse channels.  I have Roku on HDMI and ATT on HDM2 but for some reasons I cannot go back to my Uverse channels.I  added another star because I am beginning to like it although the picture is not as crisp as watching HD channels on my cable box and even if I changed the resolution.  Must be my tv settings.  I added  some channels  like Hulu, Fox and Crackle.  I already have Netflix but Hulu has the tv show that I watch so I am subscribing to Netflix and Hulu.  I am getting rid of my Uverse and  ATT told me that I can keep my router for my wifi and return the my dvr.  Next I am going to find out how to connect to  Facebook.  I  like Roku.  I also bought an indoor HD antenna but still waiting for Amazon  to deliver it. So with Roku and  antenna and subscription with Netflix and Hulu plus my internet I am spending roughly $70 a month.  Not  bad  for a retiree.
